This program can transfer files between smartphones, tablets and other computers. With it you can, for example, use your smartphone as a wireless mouse and keyboard to control your computer, among other features. It integrates better with BigLinux and is among the applets located close to the system clock. To sync with your smartphone, go to Google Store or Apple Store and install Kde Connect.

Connect to the internet using Android
You can use your Android smartphone or tablet as a wifi usb device for your computer.

How to use the internet from your Android tablet or smartphone:

1. Plug the device into the computer's USB port;
2. Go to your Android device's Settings and look for some of the options: 'USB Tethering', 'USB Dock' or 'USB Tethering'.
These are different ways that each manufacturer uses for the same feature.

*These options are within the 'Network and Internet' or 'Connections and Sharing' section.

By enabling it, you will be connected automatically, and you will be using the same connection as your Android device.
*If you are using mobile data, it will be consumed from your data plan.
It also creates a file with information, which you can send to others to help you with support.
Create, remove, and manage user accounts and groups.
Configure resolution, color, frequency, dpi, scale, night color, etc.

Install the Airmore application from your smartphone's app store.  Use this button to open the Airmore website on that computer.  Read the QRcode that will be displayed on your computer screen using the app on your smartphone and get access to file transfer and more.  You can also use our Web app manager to make it easier to use this site.

Install the Airdroid application from your smartphone's app store.  Use this button to open the Airdroid website on that computer.  Read the QRcode that will appear on your computer screen using the app on your smartphone and get access to file transfers and more.  You can also use our Web App Manager to make using this site easier.
Using Waydroid to open Android programs on BigLinux. *This feature is still in the experimental stage.
The partition the system was installed on has no restore points, but it is possible to make backups using the rsync method.

Select the desired text and use the shortcut with the [Meta] + V key or the icon in the system menu to have written text spoken.

Just open https://snapdrop.net on the Hardware you want to transfer files to, and it will automatically detect them and you can send the files you want.  Use this button to open the Snapdrop website on that computer.  Snapdrop can be used on any smartphone or computer including transferring files directly from one smartphone to another.  You can also use our web app manager to make it easier to use this site.

How to use the internet from your Android tablet or smartphone:

1. Plug the device into the computer's USB;
2. Go to your Android device's Settings and look for some of the options: 'USB Link', 'USB Anchor' or 'USB Tethering'.
They are different forms that each manufacturer uses for the same feature.

*These options are within the 'Network and Internet' or 'Connections and sharing' section.

When activated, you will be connected automatically, and you will be using the same connection as your Android device.
*If you are using mobile data, it will be consumed from your data plan.

To activate the PlayStore you need to click on (View Android ID) and copy the Android ID, then click (Enable Google Apps) to open the Device Registration page, you need to be logged into your Google account, enter your Android ID and register. It may take a few minutes to activate on your Waydroid. Close and open again. Ready!
